title: Fallout 4 Install Size and Recommended Specs Revealed
text:
Fallout 4 Install Size and Recommended Specs Revealed Share. By Luke Karmali 
Bethesda has revealed a host of details about Fallout 4 , including how much space it'll take up on your hard drive, what the minimum PC specifications are, and when the game will actually be unlocked and made available for play. 
The developer has revealed you'll need between 28GB and 35GB on console depending on where you live and what languages you want the game to support. 
Additionally, it's been announced Fallout 4 will digitally unlock on November 10, 2015, at 12:00am (local time) in all territories (In North America, the unlock time will be 12:01am EST), except Asia (available at 12am on Tuesday, November 11) and Japan (available at 12am on Thursday, December 17). Got feedback on our player? We want to hear it. 
As for the PC specifications, they're as follows: 
Minimum Windows 7/8/10 (64-bit OS required) Intel Core i5-2300 2.8 GHz/AMD Phenom II X4 945 3.0 GHz or equivalent 8 GB RAM 30 GB free HDD space NVIDIA GTX 550 Ti 2GB/AMD Radeon HD 7870 2GB or equivalent 
Recommended Windows 7/8/10 (64-bit OS required) Intel Core i7 4790 3.6 GHz/AMD FX-9590 4.7 GHz or equivalent 8 GB RAM 30 GB free HDD space NVIDIA GTX 780 3GB/AMD Radeon R9 290X 4GB or equivalent 
The game's share of your hard drive will increase over time, as Bethesda has said regular updates will be part of Fallout 4 , updates that add new features in a similar vein to Skyrim.
